newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila stocks end up, seen pausing early next week.
newsitem.headline: Manila stocks end up, seen pausing early next week.

text.p: Manila shares ended higher on Friday although early enthusiasm had waned, brokers said.
The index's rise following Thursday's 2.45 percent jump came mainly in early trade when the market was boosted further as the peso recovered from a speculative attack.
"After the initial euphoria, people are now holding back," Noel Reyes of Anscor Hagedorn Securities said.
Reyes said he expected profit-taking early next week. "But by the second day (of the week) or midweek, there will be fresh positioning on GNP," he said.
The country's second quarter gross national product figures are expected to be released towards the end of the month.
Most blue chips ended higher, except for PLDT which recovered from a mid-session fall to end steady at 1,595 pesos.
Ayala Corp B rose 50 centavos to 31.50, Meralco up 2.0 pesos to 110 and Petron up 25 centavos to 10.75 pesos.
